item.title: New York Receives Its Heaviest Snowfall in Nearly 4 Years, Disrupting Flights
item.description: Central Park saw more than four inches of snow for the first time since January 2022, with higher totals outside of New York City.

item.title: Saudi-Led Group in Yemen Tells Separatists to Withdraw, or Be ‘Dealt With’
item.description: The Saudis ramped up their rhetoric against a faction that has seized parts of Yemen in recent weeks.

item.title: Annette Dionne, Last of the Celebrated Quintuplets, Dies at 91
item.description: She was the first to crawl, the first to cut a tooth, the first to recognize her name, and the last to die. And, like her sisters, she resented being ...

item.title: Russia Pummels Kyiv Before Trump-Zelensky Meeting
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that the assault, which continued for nearly 10 hours, showed that Moscow was not serious about peace.
